Sad to see people quitting to this app because they don't know how to "launch". You don't launch wine, so pressing the green launch button will get you nowhere. You can open a terminal and use winecfg-development to configure wine. You can do wine somefile.exe to launch a windows application. That's one way to use it properly.
summary: Works great with several apps and games

description: If i need a windows application and do not want to use windows for it to work i can use wine in Linux, i find out that most games work.

It can run some Windows apps and games flawlessly. I hope it will support more apps and games in the future.

I think if you're new to linux (like me) you may want to learn about what you'll be using wine for and how to configure it properly before just installing and trying to use with a program. I am trying to run World of Warcraft currently and need a staging version with special patches to run properly. Just know you need to do a little research and tinkering and it might not run every single windows program flawlessly.
summary: Great but may require some tinkering

People seem to misunderstand that this isn't a program but a way to run Windows programs from Linux. It's matured a lot and a big thing I must say is if you're expecting Linux to be Windows and run EVERY program perfectly, you're going to be disappointed. I doubt it'll ever be so unless Microsoft actually makes a Linux distro and puts all their proprietary stuff in it. It's matured over the years and more and more programs work. People need to remember, you are trying to run a totally different OS's programs on a totally different OS. It's not gonna be perfect. My best advice to those complaining, if you want Windows compatibility to the level your looking for... Best to use Windows, then there's no disappointment. To those that understand what I just said, WINE is a nice thing to have.
If you come from windows,Its best to get PlayOnLinux after installing Wine.
Can run a wide variety of Windows executables!

ejecutándolo con el playonlinux , tienen que descargar playonlinux e ir a configuración crear nuevo perfil ponen si es para 32 bits y 64 bits una ves creado el perfil van a donde dice wine y configurar wine ( una vez abierta la pestaña de wine van donde pone versión a imitar si desean win 7.8.10 XP , etc . y guardan cierran el wine) una vez echo todo eso van la opción de MISELANEA y se dirijen en la opción ejecutar programa seleccionan el programa y instalan como lo desean luego eso se dirigen a la pestaña general y van ( crear un nuevo acceso directo ...) y seleccionan el programa que se instalo para que aparezca en el escritorio y listo una vez todo echo cierran todo lo ejecutan del escritorio y le saldrá una pestaña de wine seleccionan el programa principal y aprietan enter y disfruten ... espero que le sirva gente

description:
Franchement, je suis ce projet depuis longtemps et beaucoup d'eau à coulé sous les ponts : aujourd'hui j'arrive enfin à faire fonctionner des binaires Windows, de petites applications de tous les jours et c'est TOP.
Par contre, des produits comme Adobe Dreamweaver, il ne faut pas y compter !
Petit bémol sur la document : il est possible d'ajouter de "vrai" dll Windows dans la config, mais la documentation est trop succinte sur ce sujet comme sur beaucoup d'autre... Dommage !
summary: Encore du taf, mais TOP pour de petites applications
